Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2013 09:06AM KimbytheSea wrote: Ladies, thank you all so much. Every one of your posts helped me feel not so alone, and even optimistic. It's coming up the first week in May so I'll let you know how it goes. I have to remember not to freak if they want another view.
Posts.Title: First mammogram since surgery and treatment KimbytheSea terrikoala

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2013 11:36PM KimbytheSea wrote: I went in for my mammogram today, heart pounding, mouth dry. They had me wait after the smashing and "hold your breath"s, and I thought I'd have a heart attack, I was so scared. I kept thinking "They're gone too long. Something's wrong." Then, the radiologist came to talk to me and gave me good news. All clear. All clear. Thank God. Eight months down, 40 or so years to go....
Posts.Title: First mammogram since surgery and treatment KimbytheSea terrikoala

Posts.Content: KimbytheSea wrote: I think I'm overreacting, but I have my first mammogram since my surgery and 35 radiation treatments on May 6 and I'm scared.  I have no reason to think anything will go wrong, but I am looking at years of this, hoping each one will be clear.  I hate this.  Dignity is highly overrated.... Dx 8/3/2012, ILC, Left, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Surgery 8/16/2012 Lumpectomy: Left Radiation Therapy 9/19/2012 Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: First mammogram since surgery and treatment KimbytheSea terrikoala
